bib.title: An experimental test of the statistical theory of nuclear reactions

free_txt: SD:Updated to new date formats,lower case.
REACTION code corrected in several Subents. Angle was
added to several Subents. BIB updated.
Measurements are in favour of Fermi-gas model for
these nuclides especially with respect to the
theoretically calculated cross sections as compared
with the measured ones, the shape of the proton
spectra fitted to both theories in the region
2.5 cm * 2.5 cm, 300 mum thick Ilford C2 photographic
plate cemented in the centre of a 8 cm diam.
.It was surrounded by a 2.54 cm wide 0.05 cm thick gold
anular band with six 2.0 cm * 1.2 cm rectangular
windows through which charged particles from six
different targets could reach the plate.
.Plate and target placed in a cylindrical drum lined
.The whole assembly placed in aluminium alloy vacuum
.Plate screened from direct neutrons by 15 cm long
1.3 cm diameter copper rod with axis perpendicular on
.The neutron source is on the axis of this rod at
7.6 cm from the end and the anular band is seen under
.The rod is at right angle to the deuteron beam.
.The apparatus is rotating round its axis of symmetry
once every two minutes in order to eliminate
Most of the targets were isotropically pure (> 90 %)
and they were deposited upon the 0.01 cm gold strips as
the element, oxide or carbonate (halogen targets were
prepared from silver or tin halides). Some of the
deposits were electroplated and others were laid down
as compacted powders to form layers of thickness
0.2 to 0.5 mg/cm2 of polystyrene binder was added to
some of the powder targets to obtain a mechanically
A Pb3O4 target was exposed simultaneously with the
oxide and carbonate targets in order to measure the
Plots of ln(ro(U)) against (square root(U)) based on
the Fermi gas model in order to separate sigma(n,p)
isotopic composition of the enriched targets.
.The extrapolation of the proton spectrum below the
bias energy (3 MeV) amounts to a fairly constant 40%
